items.title: Bluetti’s 4-day Member Sale offers up to 53% discounts on power stations + bonus savings – all from $399
items.summary:
Bluetti has launched its February Member Day Sale that will only last for four days and is seeing up to 53% discounts across a selection of power stations and bundles, with special member-only deals for subscribers that save you an additional $100 to $300 over the non-member pricing, as well as bonus savings at certain thresholds. One of the top member-only picks from the lineup is Bluetti’s AC200L Portable Power Station with a 200W solar panel at $1,099 shipped, which sadly can’t stack our exclusive 5% off savings code on top, but is matching the price over at Amazon. You’d normally have to shell out $1,899 for this bundle at full price, with non-members paying an extra $100. This 4-day only deal comes as an $800 markdown off the going rate, landing it down at the third-lowest price we have tracked, though it is the best price we have seen in 2026 so far. You can also grab the standalone power station at $711.55 shipped, after using the exclusive code 9TO5TOYS5OFF at checkout. Head below to see the full lineup of deals while they last.

more…

items.title: U.S. Supreme Court tariff ruling could curb Trump's "unlimited, arbitrary tariffs": senior EP official
items.summary: BRUSSELS, Feb. 20 (Xinhua) -- Bernd Lange, chair of the European Parliament's (EP) Committee on International Trade, said on Friday that a U.S. Supreme Court ruling limiting the use of emergency powers for tariffs could help end an era of "unlimited, arbitrary tariffs" imposed by U.S. President Donald Trump. Read full story

items.title: Chinese couple makes Milan-Cortina history with dual aerials golds (updated)

items.title: Food aid in Somalia could halt within weeks due to funding shortages, WFP warns

items.summary:
Over at Amazon, you can bolster your power tool arsenal with Greenworks’ 24V 8-tool Combo Kit that comes with a 4.0Ah battery and two 2.0Ah power bank batteries at $512.99 shipped right now, beating out its direct website pricing by $237. The direct website is keeping it listed at its full $750 price, which we’ve seen cascade down with consecutive discounts over the new year – first to $600, then to $570, and now dropping even further. While we have seen this bundle go lower in 2025, you’re getting a really solid $237 markdown that lands it at the best price yet in 2026.

items.title: Massive price drops hit Anker SOLIX solar power stations, expanded battery bundles, more from $650 (Up to $4,099 off)
items.summary:
As part of the ongoing Anker SOLIX Power Deals, the brand has launched a 72-hour weekend flash sale that is cutting up to 56% off the tags on several power station bundles. Starting from the lowest-priced offer, you can pick up Anker’s SOLIX C1000 Gen 2 Portable Power Station with a 200W solar panel and a free water bottle at $649.99 shipped, beating out its Amazon pricing by $90. The bundle carries a $1,598 MSRP direct from Anker, however, it’s been readily available at Amazon keeping between $812 and $730 in 2026. While we did see it go lower in 2025, you’re still looking at a solid $162 markdown off the going rate ($948 off the MSRP) that gives you the best price we have tracked since Christmas sales ended. Head below to check out the other flash offers on bundles for the C1000 Gen 1, C2000 Gen 2, F3000, and F3800 Plus power stations.

items.title: Amazon is giving you another shot at the new Navee XT5 Pro long-range off-road e-scooter for a $1,100 low (Reg. $1,500)
items.summary:
The official Navee Amazon storefront is once again offering the best price we have seen yet on the new XT5 Pro Long-Range Off-Road Electric Scooter for $1,099.99 shipped, after clipping the on-page $500 off coupon, dropping the price $200 under the brand’s direct website. This is the newest of Navee’s e-scooters, dropping down from $1,600 on Amazon, despite it carrying a $1,500 MSRP direct from the brand. We saw this same coupon offer at the tail-end of January beating out the previous discounts to $1,400 and $1,300, with it now coming back around to save you $500 off the going rate at the all-time lowest price we have tracked. As a cheaper alternative, you can also check out our recent coverage of the GT3 series deals from Navee.

Samsung is currently offering its 2025 Galaxy Book5 Pro 14-inch 3K AMOLED Copilot+ PC for $899.99 shipped. This is regularly a $1,350 notebook, which is currently seeing a hefty $450 discount. Unlike the 16-inch version, which is more frequently discounted, the 14-inch model rarely sees price cuts. In fact, this is the lowest price we’ve tracked for this model to date, which we’ve previously only seen it fetch as part of Samsung’s EPP/EDU programs. Best Buy is also matching this price right now, so it’s worth keeping an eye on their listing in case Samsung’s deal disappears.

That’s a straight-up $390 discount on its $1,100 usual going rate, and one of the lowest prices we have tracked for it to date. Today’s deal at Best Buy marks the lowest price we have tracked for this unit this year, and it’s now within just $60 of the all-time low price it hit last year during the holiday sale. The same monitor, in case you’re wondering, is currently going for $750 at both Amazon and directly at Samsung’s online store, so you’re looking at the best price for it at the moment at Best Buy. It’s one of the best options to consider if you’re in the market to buy an ultrawide display for your battlestation, and you can learn more about it below.

items.title: Woot’s charging accessories sale back at up to 76% off: Anker 3-in-1 charging stations, power banks, more from just $8
items.summary:
Woot is back with another charging accessories sale, and it’s delivering up to a whopping 76% off this time on a wide range of gear, including charging stations and power banks. The lineup features popular options from Apple, Anker, Otterbox, and other familiar brands we feature a lot around here, with deals starting at just $7.99 Prime shipped (a $6 delivery fee will apply otherwise). This is a great time to jump in and check out these if you’ve been thinking about upgrading your charging setup, as many of these either hitting fresh lows or down to some of their lowest prices. Head below for more details.

more…

items.title: It’s back and now even lower: Apple’s black braided Thunderbolt Pro Cable now down at $31 (55% off)
items.summary:
We spotted a relatively rare deal on the official 1-meter Apple Thunderbolt 4 (USB‑C) Pro Cable earlier this week, but Woot is now offering an even lower price using code APPLEFIVE at checkout. You can now land this regularly $69 Apple cable down at $31 Prime shipped, which is well below the price you’ll pay at Amazon right now. You’ll also find official Apple 240W woven USB-C cables starting down at $17 Prime shipped using the same code (prices will go even lower if you buy more than one).

items.title: Uber's market cap fell to ~$150B, down ~25% in six months, as investors weigh robotaxi disruption and see the market as a two-horse race between Waymo and Tesla (Dan Gallagher/Wall Street Journal)
items.summary:
Dan Gallagher / Wall Street Journal:
Uber's market cap fell to ~$150B, down ~25% in six months, as investors weigh robotaxi disruption and see the market as a two-horse race between Waymo and Tesla  —  Waymo's momentum is undeniable, but Uber's scale is being undervalued in AI-driven selloff  —  Uber can't seem to emerge from the shadow of what's to come.
